alert.note: Alert for Bighorn Mountains West; Cody Foothills; North Big Horn Basin; Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains; Southeast Big Horn Basin; Southwest Big Horn Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 4:32PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorm winds will impact portions of north central Hot Springs, Big Horn, northwestern Washakie and east central Park Counties through 515 PM MDT... At 429 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorm outflow along a line extending from near Bighorn Lake to 7 miles north of Cody. Movement was southeast at 40 to 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph with gusts approaching 60 mph. Gusts over 60 mph were reported at the Cowley airport. SOURCE...Radar and weather instrument indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Greybull around 445 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include much of the northern Bighorn Basin. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If on or near Bighorn Reservoir or on the Bighorn River, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
